questions.question: Calculate \( 33 \times 2.13 \times 81.23 \times 3.23.524 \), giving your answer correct to 4 significant figures.
questions.question_type: Rounding a decimal to a specified number of significant figures

questions.question:
At a warehouse sale, all prices are reduced by 15%. The price of a set of ear pods during the sale is $221. 

(i) Find its original price.
questions.question_type: Finding the original value using reverse percentages

questions.question: If the salesman still earns a profit of 10.5% during the sale, find the percentage profit he earns from selling the pair of ear pods if it is not on sale.
questions.question_type: Finding the original value using reverse percentages

questions.question:
Ethan measures the amount of rain, in millimetres (mm), each day for 31 days. The bar chart shows his results. 

(a) Write down the median amount of rain.
questions.question_type: Finding the mean, median and mode

questions.question: (b) Find the mean amount of rain per day.
questions.question_type: Finding the mean, median and mode

questions.question: (c) Ethan picks one of these days at random. Find the probability that, on that day, the amount of rain was 3 mm or more.
questions.question_type: Finding the probability of single events

questions.question:
These are the first four terms in a sequence: 9, 5, 1, -3. 

(a) Find an expression, in terms of \( n \), for the \( n \)-th term of the sequence.
questions.question_type: Finding the nth term of a sequence with a common difference

questions.question: (b) The \( n \)-th term of another sequence is given by \( T_n = \frac{3n}{4} + 43 \). Determine if it is possible to have a term in the sequence to be greater than 1. Explain your answer.
questions.question_type: Solving a problem on number patterns

questions.question: A drawer contains 40 balls. 15 balls are black, 5 balls are grey and 20 balls are white. Samuel chooses one ball from the drawer at random. (a) Find the probability that the ball is not black.
questions.question_type: Finding the probability of single events

questions.question: Samuel adds a few more grey balls. The probability of choosing a grey ball is now \( \frac{2}{7} \). (b) Find the number of grey balls he added.
questions.question_type: Finding the probability of single events

questions.question: Solve the simultaneous equations: \( 7x + 2y = 8 \) and \( 3x - y = 3 \).
questions.question_type: Solving simultaneous equations using the method of elimination

questions.question: The diagram shows part of a polygon A and part of polygon B. A is a regular polygon with \( n \) sides. B is a regular hexagon. Find the value of \( n \).
questions.question_type: Finding the number of sides of a polygon

questions.question: Mary needs to pack 210 oranges, 252 apples and 294 pears into identical fruit baskets. (i) What is the largest possible number of fruit baskets that can be packed?
questions.question_type: Unknown

questions.question: (ii) State the number of each fruit in a fruit basket.
questions.question_type: Unknown

questions.question: The diagram shows a sector OPR with centre O. ORQ is a straight line. Angle POQ = 0.6 radians. OP = 5 cm and RQ = 7 cm. (i) Calculate the perimeter of the shaded region PQR.
questions.question_type: Finding the arc length and area of a sector

questions.question: (ii) Calculate the area of the shaded region PQR.
questions.question_type: Finding the arc length and area of a sector

questions.question: A, B \text{ and } C \text{ are three ports.} \newline (a) \text{ Show that angle } ABC = 107.2^\circ \text{ correct to 1 decimal place.}
questions.question_type: Unknown

questions.question: (b) \text{ The bearing of B from A is } 305^\circ. \text{ Find the bearing of C from A.}
questions.question_type: Unknown

questions.question: \text{Expand and simplify } (2x - 3)^2.
questions.question_type: Using algebraic identities in algebraic expansion

questions.question: \text{The length of one of the diagonals of a rhombus of side 13 cm is 24 cm. Find the area of the rhombus.}
questions.question_type: Unknown

questions.question: p \text{ varies inversely as the square root of } q. \newline \text{When } q = 9, p = 12. \newline \text{Find } p \text{ when } q = 16.
questions.question_type: Graphs of functions in the form a/x and a/x2
Finding the ratio involving 2 quantities

questions.question: \text{Solve the inequalities } 2x + 6 \leq 11 < 24 - 23x.
questions.question_type: Solving a linear inequality

questions.question: \text{In the diagram, } O \text{ is the centre of two concentric circles. A and B lie on the circumference of the smaller circle. C and D lie on the circumference of the larger circle. AD and BC intersect at O.} \newline (a) \text{ Prove that } \triangle AOC \text{ and } \triangle BOD \text{ are congruent.}
questions.question_type: Proving the 2 triangles are congruent

questions.question: (b) \text{ Prove that } \triangle ADB \text{ and } \triangle BCA \text{ are congruent.}
questions.question_type: Proving the 2 triangles are congruent

questions.question: PQRS \text{ is a trapezium where } P \text{ is the point } (-3, 2), Q \text{ is the point } (5, 8) \text{ and } R \text{ is the point } (3, 2). \newline PQ \text{ is parallel to } RS. \newline (a) \text{ Find the equation of the line } RS.
questions.question_type: Finding the equation of a straight line

questions.question: (b)(i) \text{ Find the length of } PQ.
questions.question_type: Finding the length of a line segment

questions.question: (ii) \text{ Hence find the perpendicular distance from } R \text{ to } PQ.
questions.question_type: Finding the length of a line segment

questions.question: In the diagram, points A, B, and C lie on a straight line. BC = 12 \text{ cm}, DC = 5 \text{ cm}, \text{ and } \angle BCD = 90^\circ. \text{ Find the value of } \cos \angle ABD.
questions.question_type: Finding the trigonometric ratios of acute and obtuse angles

questions.question: Write as a single fraction in its simplest form \frac{2}{12} - \frac{9}{1} - \frac{1}{3x}.
questions.question_type: Adding and subtracting algebraic fractions

questions.question: A, D, B, and C lie on a circle, center O. AP is a tangent to the circle at A and BP is a tangent to the circle at B. \angle AOB = 142^\circ \text{ and } \angle DAP = 42^\circ. \text{ (a) Find the value of (i) } \angle ACB, \text{ (ii) } \angle ADB. \text{ (b) Is OB parallel to AD? Explain.}
questions.question_type: Applying the angles properties of circles

questions.question: The admission tickets to the Singapore Zoo are $50 for an adult, $36 for a child, and $20 for a senior citizen. On a particular Tuesday, there were 212 adults, 251 children, and 15 senior citizens who visited the Singapore Zoo and on a particular Wednesday, there were 231 adults, 266 children, and 12 senior citizens who visited the Singapore Zoo. The number of visitors on the particular Tuesday and Wednesday can be represented by the matrix V = \begin{pmatrix} 212 & 251 & 15 \\ 231 & 266 & 12 \end{pmatrix}. \text{ (i) Write a } 3 \times 1 \text{ matrix, P, to represent the price of the admission tickets. (ii) Find the matrix } T = VP. \text{ (iii) Explain what each of the elements represents. (iv) Find the total amount collected from the sales of the tickets for the 2 days.}
questions.question_type: Multiplication of 2 matrices

questions.question: Rearrange this equation to make x the subject. \frac{23}{5} = \frac{ab}{x} - x
questions.question_type: Solving fractional equations that can be reduced to quadratic equations

questions.question: Given that 2^{32} \times 1 = 6 \times 8^x, \text{ find the value of } x.
questions.question_type: Evaluating an algebraic formula

questions.question: The angle of elevation of the base of a lighthouse, L, from two fishing boats P and Q are 20^\circ \text{ and } 35^\circ \text{ respectively. Given that the fishing boat P is 250 m from the lighthouse, find the distance between the two fishing boats.}
questions.question_type: Using the Sine rule to find an unknown side

questions.question: 100 \text{ newborn babies are weighed and their masses are recorded in the table below.} \\ \begin{array}{|c|c|} \hline \text{Mass } (x \text{ kg}) & \text{Frequency} \\ \hline 2.8 < x \leq 3.0 & 6 \\ 3.0 < x \leq 3.2 & 21 \\ 3.2 < x \leq 3.4 & 47 \\ 3.4 < x \leq 3.6 & 22 \\ 3.6 < x \leq 3.8 & 4 \\ \hline \end{array} \\ \text{(a) Calculate an estimate for} \\ \text{(i) the mean mass of these newborn babies,} \\ \text{(ii) the standard deviation of the mass of these newborn babies.} \\ \text{(b) If the weighing machine has an error of weighing an extra 0.2 kg, comment on how this error affects the standard deviation of the mass of these newborn babies.}
questions.question_type: Finding the mean and standard deviation using mid-values

questions.question: \text{20, 1, 3, 3, } \pi, \text{ 7} \in \xi = \left\{ -1, 3, 7 \right\} \\ A = \left\{ x : x \text{ is a rational number} \right\} \\ B = \left\{ x : x \text{ is an integer} \right\} \\ C = \left\{ x : x \text{ is a positive number} \right\} \\ \text{(i) Use one of the symbols below to fill in the blank in the answer space.} \\ =, \subset, \supset, \in, \notin \\ \text{Answer } \left\{ -1, 3, 7 \right\} \ldots B \\ \text{(ii) List the elements of } A \cap C. \\ \text{Answer } A \cap C = \ldots \\ \text{(iii) Write down, in set notation, in terms of A, B and/or C the set that represents rational numbers that are not integers.}
questions.question_type: Listing the elements of the intersection and union of 2 sets

questions.question: \text{(b) In the diagram, shade the region representing } P \cap Q.
questions.question_type: Shading Venn diagrams, given the set notations
